forms: HSD FORM A – MBE/WBE Subcontractor Utilization Form
HSD FORM B – MBE/WBE Subcontractor Solicitation Form

e_verify_documentation.option1: E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification page listing the consultant’s/contractor’s name and company ID
e_verify_documentation.option2: A page from the E-Verify Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) listing the consultant’s/contractor’s name and the MOU signature page completed and signed, at minimum, by the consultant/contractor and the Department of Homeland Security – Verification Division

business_entity_certification.box_b: Certification that (Business Entity Name) meets the definition of a business entity as defined in section 285.525, RSMo, pertaining to section 285.530.
business_entity_certification.box_c: Certification that (Business Entity Name) meets the definition of a business entity, participates in E-Verify, and has previously submitted E-Verify documentation to a Missouri state agency or public university within the past twelve months.  Includes providing name of agency/university, date of submission, and previous RFP/RFQ number (if known).

Format Requirements: Form A: Subcontractor Utilization Form (details work to be subcontracted with MBE/WBE firms, including amounts)
Form B: MBE/WBE Subcontractor Solicitation Report (lists contacted minority and women business enterprises and reasons for not subcontracting with them)
Business Entity Certification, Enrollment Documentation, and Affidavit of Work Authorization (certification of current business status using Box A, B, or C)
Required Sections: Client References (at least three for completed work in the last 1-2 years with organization name, address, phone, contact person, project description, and contract amount)
Documentation of 10-hour OSHA construction safety program completion for workers (if applicable)
MBE/WBE Certification: Acceptance of MBE/WBE certification from specified agencies (City of St. Louis, SLMSDC, MRCC, State Certifications, NMSDC, WBENC and affiliates, state division of purchasing for manufacturers)
Only certified MBE/WBE firms on or before the proposal opening date are eligible

A MBE or WBE Subcontractor may be included as a Joint Venture with a Non-Certified MBE/WBE on Form A. However, only the portion of work to be managed and performed by the Certified MBE/WBE may be counted towards the goal.
Other Requirements: Twenty-five percent (25%) MBE and five percent (5%) WBE participation goals for construction projects
Twenty-five percent (25%) minority and five percent (5%) women workforce goals
Proposals may not be withdrawn for 60 days after the proposal receipt deadline

Deadlines.Proposal Opening Date: MBE/WBE firms must be certified by one or more of the specified agencies on or before the proposal opening date.

Submission Process.Download Forms: The Hazelwood School District Supplier Diversity Program, including Forms A and B, can be downloaded from www.hazelwoodschools.org (click on "Proposals and Proposals", then "Documentation")

Award Criteria: Responsiveness and completeness of the vendor’s proposal
Proposer’s understanding of and ability to address the RFP requirements
Proposer’s experience and reference of similar sized school district clients
Proposer’s ability to provide the requested services
Project approach: Logical, organized, innovative understanding, and experience with similar projects

submission_process.method: Not specified in this chunk, but implied to be with the proposal response.
